  "Broker Comment" : "AXA MANAGING PRINCIPLE FOUND THAT THERE WAS NO BASIS FOR THE CUSTOMER COMPLAINT AND, THAT THERE HAD BEEN NO MISREPRESENTAION BY THE UNDERSIGNED, THE FORMER EQUITABLE AGENT. NORMAL PROTOCOL (FOR EQUITABLE) IN A CUSTOMER INITIATED COMPLAINT WAS FOLLOWED AND CLIENTS MONEY WAS RETURNED.AN APPEAL AND/OR EXPUNGEMENT WILL BE SOUGHT TO HAVE THE ALLEGATION REMOVED FROM THE CRD RECORD. IF NECESSARY, A CIVIL CASE OF DEFAMATION AGAINST THE FORMER CLIENT WILL BE FILED TO SECURE EXPUNGEMENT.ALTHOUGH THE FORMER CLIENT ALLEGED MISREPRESENTATION. IT WAS CLEAR FROM THE RESPONSE WRITTEN BY THE MANAGING PRINCIPLE THAT THE CLIENT FILE WAS IN PERFECT ORDER, AND THAT ALL NOTATION THEREIN INDICATED THAT THE CLIENT DID NOT DISCLOSE THAT HE HAD NOT PAID ANY FURTHER PREMIUMS INTO THE POLICY IN QUESTION AND MOREOVER HAD WITHDRAWN MONIES OUT OF THE POLICY CONTRARY TO THE DEMONSTRATED PLAN OF ACTION.THE ORIGINAL PLAN WAS FOR THE CLIENT NOT ONLY TO START PAYING MONEY INTO THE POLICY AFTER YEAR TWO, BUT MOREOVER NOT TO WITHDRAW MONEY OUT. IN SUMMATION THE RESPONSE LETTER FROM THE PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING THE CASE SAID,\"I FIND NO BASIS IN MR. [CUSTOMER]COMPLAINT\"."
